text: Hansford Rowe (May 12, 1924 â€“ September 5, 2017) was an American character actor. He was born in Richmond, Virginia. He appeared in television and movie roles. His career began in 1967. In 1968, he had a non-speaking role as a judge in three episodes of the cult series Dark Shadows. In 1969, he played a judge on the long-running CBS daytime drama The Guiding Light. Rowe played in the 1983 NBC miniseries V as Arthur Dupres. Rowe was also known for playing President Harry S. Truman in Dark Skies. His movie roles include Gordon's War (1973), Missing (1982) and Baby Boom (1987). Rowe died was killed in a car crash in Newhall, California on September 5, 2017 at the age of 93. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1924 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Actors from Richmond, Virginia Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:American voice actors Category:Road accident deaths in California
title: Hansford Rowe
